attributes.title: Quent
attributes.image: Stark guard (The Old Gods and the New).jpg
attributes.actor: Aidan Crowe'''Quent''' is a recurring character in the Season 2
attributes.7: yes==In the books==In the ''A Song of Ice and Fire'' novels, Quent is a House Stark guardsman. He accompanies Bran and Robb to the Wolfswood during Bran's first ride since being crippled. After the outbreak of the War of the Five Kings, Quent marches south with the rest of the Northern force, and fights under the command of Hallis Mollen, the Winterfell captain of the guards after Jory Cassel's departure. Quent is one of the guardsmen ordered to accompany Ned Stark's remains to Winterfell after they are returned to Robb Stark as a gesture of goodwill by Tyrion Lannister.==See also==* AWOIAF==References==ReflistCategory:CharactersCategory:Season 2 CharactersCategory:Recurring CharactersCategory:Status: UncertainCategory:House StarkCategory:SmallfolkCategory:Characters from the North

sections.In the books: In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Quent is a House Stark guardsman. He accompanies [[Bran]] and Robb to the [[Wolfswood]] during Bran's first ride since being crippled. After the outbreak of the [[War of the Five Kings]], Quent marches south with the rest of the Northern force, and fights under the command of [[Hallis Mollen]], the Winterfell captain of the guards after [[Jory Cassel]]'s departure. Quent is one of the guardsmen ordered to accompany [[Ned Stark]]'s remains to [[Winterfell]] after they are returned to Robb Stark as a gesture of goodwill by [[Tyrion Lannister]].
sections.Biography:
===[[Season 2]]===
He is warmly greeted by [[King]] [[Robb Stark]] as he tours the camp.<ref>"[[The Old Gods and the New]]"</ref> He is present when [[Ser]] [[Jaime Lannister]] is recaptured and returned to the camp.<ref>"[[A Man Without Honor]]"</ref>
